metadata.name: Install MCP Server in VS Code Extensions
metadata.description: Install a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server to extend GitHub Copilot Agent Mode with new tools for external service integration
metadata.context: VS Code Extensions for Agent Mode enhancement

outputs: MCP server installed and visible in Extensions list
New tools available in Copilot Agent Mode tool selector
mcp.json configuration file created (workspace or user-level)

steps.description: Open the Extensions panel in VS Code by clicking the Extensions icon in the left sidebar (four squares icon)
Locate and click on the 'MCP SERVERS' section in the Extensions panel
steps.output: MCP Servers section expanded, showing installed servers or 'Browse' link

steps.description: Click the link to browse available MCP servers on the VS Code MCP marketplace website
steps.output: VS Code MCP marketplace page loaded in web browser

steps.description: Choose desired MCP server from marketplace (e.g., GitHub, Notion, Stripe, Zapier, etc.)
steps.output: Server details page loaded with Install button visible
steps.note: Popular servers: GitHub (repo operations), Notion (docs), Stripe (payments), Zapier (automation)

steps.description: Click the 'Install' button on the server's marketplace page
steps.output: Browser prompts to open link in VS Code

steps.description: Allow the browser to open the installation link in VS Code application
steps.output: VS Code opens with MCP server extension page displayed

steps.description: Click the 'Install' button within the VS Code extension page for the MCP Server
steps.output: Installation progress shown, then server appears in MCP SERVERS list

steps.description: Right-click the newly installed server in the MCP SERVERS list and select 'Start Server'
steps.output: Server status changes to 'Running' or authentication prompt appears

steps.description: Complete the authentication flow for the external service (e.g., GitHub login, API key entry, OAuth flow)
steps.output: Authentication successful, server status shows 'Connected' or 'Running'
steps.note: Authentication method varies by service (OAuth, API key, etc.)

steps.description: Open Copilot chat, check the Tools section to confirm new MCP server tools are visible and selectable
steps.output: New tools from MCP server visible in Copilot Agent Mode tool selector
steps.success_criteria: Can select and invoke MCP server tools in agent prompts

quality_checklist: MCP server appears in Extensions > MCP SERVERS list
New tools visible in Copilot Agent Mode tool selector
Can invoke MCP server tools in agent chat prompts
mcp.json file created in appropriate location (.vscode/ or user settings)
Server logs show no connection errors

troubleshooting.server_wont_start: Check authentication credentials, restart VS Code, verify service status online
troubleshooting.tools_not_visible: Verify server status is 'Running', refresh Copilot chat, restart VS Code
troubleshooting.authentication_fails: Re-authenticate service, check API key validity, verify account permissions
troubleshooting.installation_fails: Check internet connection, verify VS Code version is up-to-date, try user-level install instead of workspace

configuration_notes.workspace_vs_user: Workspace: Install in project .vscode/mcp.json for project-specific servers. User: Install globally for all projects.
configuration_notes.config_file_location_user: VS Code user settings (varies by OS)

related_entities.workflow: WF-DEV-005 (Discover and Install an MCP Server)
